{"id":1296801078,"question_id":3475,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"5Â months","timestamp":1719069594,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"83 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1296801078/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Binary Array Elements Equal to One I","memory":"138.5 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    Solution(){\n        ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false);\n        cin.tie(nullptr);\n        cout.tie(nullptr);\n    }\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums) {\n        \n        int n = nums.size();\n        int changes = 0;\n        \n        for(int i=0; i<n-2; i++){\n            if(nums[i]==0){\n                nums[i] = 1;\n                nums[i+1] ^= 1;\n                nums[i+2] ^= 1;\n                changes += 1;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if(nums[n-1]==0 || nums[n-2]==0){\n            return -1;\n        }\n        return changes;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-binary-array-elements-equal-to-one-i","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
